title: Wood Type Slab Serif font used in YellaFella campaign
content:
[http://www.yellafella.com/index.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20090927124529/http:/www.yellafella.com/index.php "http://www.yellafella.com/index.php")  
 [http://byrdhouse.typepad.com/.a/6a00d8341c641b53ef01053720c1b9970b-800wi](http://web.archive.org/web/20090927124529/http:/byrdhouse.typepad.com/.a/6a00d8341c641b53ef01053720c1b9970b-800wi "http://byrdhouse.typepad.com/.a/6a00d8341c641b53ef01053720c1b9970b-800wi")

Need assistance identifying the font used in this campaign.

Thank you in advance.
author: typenerd

comments.content:
This one I recognize!

[http://www.djr.com/typefaces/manicotti](http://web.archive.org/web/20090927124529/http:/www.djr.com/typefaces/manicotti "http://www.djr.com/typefaces/manicotti")

Haven’t gotten around to actually releasing it, but you can get in touch for licensing info...

The condensed companion is Mesquite I think.

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/mesquite](http://web.archive.org/web/20090927124529/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/mesquite "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/mesquite")

Cheers,  
David
Congratulations, looks perfect at this announcement.

It’s great when we can get designer participation. Thanks for joining in David. I agree with Renko, it looks great, and it has a dynamic flair that ought to make it in demand when it’s available. It’s NOT your typical Western typeface.

- Mike Yanega
Great Western! I’ll be staying tuned for that one.
